alert.note: Alert for Appling; Bacon; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Bacon, northwestern Wayne and southeastern Appling Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 130 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 8 miles northwest of Bristol, or 11 miles east of Alma, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Odum and Doctortown. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia.
